dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: President Biden on Monday, he denounced the actions of peaceful protesters in Portland, but then called Kyle Rittenhouse a hero.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: President Biden on Monday, he denounced the actions of peaceful protesters in Portland, but then called Kyle Rittenhouse a hero.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: After asserting that former Vice President Joe Biden failed to adequately denounce protest violence, President Donald Trump on Monday defended the violent actions of a caravan of his supporters in Portland, Ore., as well as those of Kyle Rittenhouse, a 17-year-old accused of murdering two protesters in Kenosha, Wisconsin. Asked about Rittenhouse, Trump called it an interesting situation, and claimed Rittenhouse was trying to get away from protesters who violently attacked him, asserting, without evidence, that Rittenhouse probably would've been killed.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and he said paint is not bullets, which is such a strange line to drop in the middle of all this.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and he said paint is not bullets, which is such a strange line to drop in the middle of all this.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But given the opportunity to denounce a caravan of his supporters in Portland, who were caught on video Saturday shooting protesters with paintballs or tear gas, Trump called it a peaceful protest and declared paint is not bullets.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And Trump's out here saying "peaceful protest is the American way," after he denounced the far-right.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And Trump's out here saying peaceful protest is the American way, after he denounced the far-right.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Biden offered a stern condemnation of protest violence in his speech, declaring rioting is not protesting after unequivocally denouncing violence on the left and right and calling on Trump to do the same in a statement on Sunday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But then Biden team criticized him for not mentioning patriots specifically—like, that feels so nitpicky.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then Biden team criticized him for not mentioning patriots specifically-like, that feels so nitpicky.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bidens remarks were met with immediate dissatisfaction from the Trump team, with Trump campaign advisor Jason Miller hitting Biden for not specifically mentioning radical left-wing groups like Antifa in his blanket denunciation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And Biden goes, uh, "He mentioned law enforcement, but he didn't mention the patriots, I wonder why."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And Biden goes, uh, He mentioned law enforcement, but he didn't mention the patriots, I wonder why.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He mentioned law enforcement, but he didnt mention Antifa, I wonder why, Trump added, claiming Biden would give the decentralized anarchist group the far-left policy agenda its asking for.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which is just… ironic, because then Biden himself didn't praise those Portland protesters supporting law enforcement.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is just... ironic, because then Biden himself didn't praise those Portland protesters supporting law enforcement.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Biden campaign released a statement calling Trump too weak, too scared, to repudiate one of his supporters. In the statement, Biden urged Trump to join me in saying that while peaceful protest is a right a necessity violence is wrong, period.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And calling Rittenhouse a hero without evidence? That's a bold move, especially when he's also talking about self-defense claims.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And calling Rittenhouse a hero without evidence? That's a bold move, especially when he's also talking about self-defense claims.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Asked about Rittenhouse, Trump called it an interesting situation, and claimed Rittenhouse was trying to get away from protesters who violently attacked him, asserting, without evidence, that Rittenhouse probably would've been killed.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Then there's Trump traveling to Kenosha tomorrow—Biden said it "could increase enthusiasm, it could increase love and respect for our country."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Then there's Trump traveling to Kenosha tomorrow-Biden said it could increase enthusiasm, it could increase love and respect for our country.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Should be very interesting, Trump said of the visit, predicting It could increase enthusiasm, it could increase love and respect for our country, after he was asked about concerns it could increase violence.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: After the governor already praised the positive efforts there. It's like they're living in two different realities.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: After the governor already praised the positive efforts there. It's like they're living in two different realities.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And Biden's whole "Do I look like a radical extremist with a soft spot for rioters?" line—such performative stuff.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Biden's whole Do I look like a radical extremist with a soft spot for rioters? line-such performative stuff.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Ask yourself: Do I look to you like a radical socialist with a soft spot for rioters? Really?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Meanwhile, Trump's campaign calls Biden too weak to praise his own supporters. It's just back and forth, no real resolution.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Meanwhile, Trump's campaign calls Biden too weak to praise his own supporters. It's just back and forth, no real resolution.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Biden campaign released a statement calling Trump too weak, too scared, to repudiate one of his supporters.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Feels like we're stuck in this cycle where condemnation only goes one way depending on who's protesting.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Feels like we're stuck in this cycle where condemnation only goes one way depending on who's protesting.

artist_script:
HostA: President Biden on Monday, he denounced the actions of peaceful protesters in Portland, but then called Kyle Rittenhouse a hero.
HostB: Yeah, and he said paint is not bullets, which is such a strange line to drop in the middle of all this.
HostA: Right? And Trump’s out here saying “peaceful protest is the American way,” after he denounced the far-right.
HostB: But then Biden team criticized him for not mentioning patriots specifically—like, that feels so nitpicky.
HostA: Exactly! And Biden goes, uh, “He mentioned law enforcement, but he didn’t mention the patriots, I wonder why.”
HostB: Which is just… ironic, because then Biden himself didn’t praise those Portland protesters supporting law enforcement.
HostA: And calling Rittenhouse a hero without evidence? That’s a bold move, especially when he’s also talking about self-defense claims.
HostB: Then there’s Trump traveling to Kenosha tomorrow—Biden said it “could increase enthusiasm, it could increase love and respect for our country.”
HostA: After the governor already praised the positive efforts there. It’s like they’re living in two different realities.
HostB: And Biden’s whole “Do I look like a radical extremist with a soft spot for rioters?” line—such performative stuff.
HostA: Meanwhile, Trump’s campaign calls Biden too weak to praise his own supporters. It’s just back and forth, no real resolution.
HostB: Feels like we’re stuck in this cycle where condemnation only goes one way depending on who’s protesting.
